results.p: Communicate digitally with the same level of privacy and security as the spoken word. With encrypted, self-destructing, and screenshot-proof messages.
1. to have confidence : trust We cannot confide wholly in our own powers. 2. to show confidence by imparting secrets confide in a friend.
to tell something secret or personal to someone who you trust not to tell anyone else. [ + that ] He confided (to her) that his hair was not his own.
results.t: CONFIDE | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary

results.p: To confide in someone is to tell them something privately. We confide in people we trust.

results.p: Confide definition: to impart secrets trustfully; discuss private matters or problems (usually followed by in). See examples of CONFIDE used in a sentence.
CONFIDE meaning: 1 : to tell (something that is secret or private) to someone you trust often + to; 2 : to tell personal and private things to (someone)
2 days ago — CONFIDE IN SOMEONE meaning: 1. to share your feelings and secrets with someone because you trust them not to tell other people…. Learn more.
